seo.title: Expert .NET 8 Migration Services | Minimal Downtime
seo.description: Seamlessly upgrade to .NET 8 with SSW. Enjoy faster performance, reduced load times, and lower memory usage. Book your FREE initial consultation today

blocks.finalBreadcrumb: Enterprise Development and Consulting for .NET 8 Migration

blocks.heading: Expert .NET 8 migrations. Minimal business disruption.
blocks.description: Minimize downtime and maximize performance. We specialize in smooth, expert .NET 8 upgrades, ensuring your business stays online and benefits from the latest .NET features

blocks.heading: Strategic .NET 8 migration
blocks.body: Your .NET applications need care and planning to upgrade to version 8. The payoff? More stable, efficient systems that keep your business running at top speed. Weâ€™ll handle upgrades so you can sleep at night, knowing your vital operations wonâ€™t skip a beat.

accordionItems.label: Phase 1: Assessment
accordionItems.content:
We start with a comprehensive evaluation of your current system through our **Specification Review.** This critical first step helps us:

* Map out your application's architecture and dependencies: Gain a clear understanding of your current .NET Framework or previous .NET Core versions, identifying all components and their inter-relationships for a smoother upgrade process.

<!---->

* Identify potential migration challenges and compatibility issues: Proactively pinpoint roadblocks and .NET 8 compatibility concerns early on, minimizing risks during the migration execution. This is where our expertise with tools like the .NET Upgrade Assistant proves invaluable.

<!---->

* Document critical business functionality that must be preserved: Ensure no essential features are overlooked during the .NET upgrade, safeguarding core business operations throughout the migration to .NET 8.

<!---->

* Assess your team's readiness and training needs: Evaluate your team's current skill set and identify any training requirements to effectively manage and maintain your applications post .NET 8 migration.

accordionItems.label: Phase 2: Strategy Selection
accordionItems.content:
Strangler Fig Method: Perfect for bigger, complex apps. We replace old parts bit by bit, keeping your system stable. This works well when you need to:

* Keep critical systems running 24/7
* Test changes safely in production
* Manage risk with gradual updates\\

Big Bang Approach: Built for smaller apps or quick switches. We upgrade everything at once in a coordinated push. This fits best when you:

* Have a simpler codebase
* Need to move fast
* Can handle brief downtime

accordionItems.label: Phase 3: Planning
accordionItems.content:
For each part of your system, we'll pick one of these three paths:

Path 1: Refactor

* Add .NET 8's new features to your existing code
* Keep your business logic intact while making it faster
* Get your packages and dependencies up to date

Path 2: Replace

* Find better options for older components
* Pick third-party tools that fit your needs
* Hook everything into your current setup smoothly

Path 3: Rebuild

* Start fresh when old code isn't worth fixing
* Build with clean, modern patterns
* Use .NET 8's best features from the ground up

accordionItems.label: Phase 4: Migration Execution
accordionItems.content:
We stick to proven dev practices:

* Run parallel test environments to catch issues early
* Deploy through automated CI/CD pipelines
* Test thoroughly at every step
* Watch system health in real-time
* Keep rollback plans ready (just in case)

accordionItems.label: Phase 5: Optimization
accordionItems.content:
After the upgrade, we make sure everything runs at peak performance:

* Speed up slow spots in your code
* Lock down security
* Train your team on the new setup
* Update all your docs
* Set up long-term monitoring

blocks.heading: BizCover: From microservice maze to monolith magic
blocks.description: We Marie Kondo'd BizCover's codebase, swapping their microservice sprawl for a tidy .NET8 modular monolith (MoMo). Domain-driven design helped us define the modules, while OpenTelemetry, Prometheus, and Grafana kept things monitored.

features.heading: Thanks to the whole team for making this happen. This is a first and very important step in our strategy to support the business objective of being able to onboard new products and insurers quickly.

mediaConfiguration.altText: BizCover: From microservice maze to monolith magic

cards.altText: Breaking down .NET Aspire: Your gateway to cloud native apps
cards.heading: Breaking Down .NET Aspire: Your Gateway to Cloud Native Apps
cards.description: SSW's Matt Wicks teams up with Octopus Deploy's Rob Pearson to demystify .NET Aspire. Dive into real-world orchestration, service integration, and deployment strategies that'll level up your cloud-native game.

cards.description: Stop wrestling with UI and API code! Matt Goldman (author of .NET MAUI in Action) reveals how to nail Clean Architecture across MAUI and ASP.NET Core without the classic pitfalls. Expect real demos, not just theory.

blocks.heading: Frequently Asked Questions
blocks.body: Need quick answers about .NET 8 migration? Here's what tech teams commonly ask us during assessment calls.

accordionItems.label: Is .NET 8 worth the migration effort?
accordionItems.content:
Yes, if you're running applications on older .NET versions. .NET 8 offers:

* Extended support until November 2026
* Significant performance improvements
* Better cloud integration
* Latest security features and patches
* Access to new C# 12 features

accordionItems.label: What about our existing dependencies?
accordionItems.content:
We audit your NuGet packages first. Most popular packages already support .NET 8. For others, we'll either:

* Update to compatible versions
* Find modern alternatives
* Create compatibility shims

accordionItems.label: How do we prep our team for .NET8?
accordionItems.content:
Quick checklist:

1. Set up .NET 8 SDK
2. Review breaking changes
3. Run compatibility analyzer
4. Test on a small project
5. Plan deployment strategy

accordionItems.label: What kind of support is available post-migration?
accordionItems.content:
Our support includes:

* Performance monitoring
* Security updates
* Optional managed services
* Regular health checks
* Continuous optimization

blocks.heading: Talk to us about your .NET 8 project today
